Map package

Module documentation for the map package.

map.map

map.cell

class map.map.Map(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Singleton

Grid that stores cells and provides helpers to place and reconnect structures.

Parameters:

  • width (int)

  • height (int)

width

Number of columns (x).

Type:

int

height

Number of rows (y).

Type:

int

cells

2D list of Cell instances indexed as cells[y][x].

Type:

list[list[Cell]]

getCell(x, y)

Return the Cell at grid coordinates (x, y) or None if out of bounds.

Parameters:

  • x (int)

  • y (int)

Return type:

Cell | None

isInsideBounds(x, y)
Parameters:

  • x (int)

  • y (int)

Return type:

bool

classmethod load_from_file(filepath, creators=None, gameManager=None)

Load a map from filepath and optionally recreate structures.

Parameters:

  • filepath (str) – Path to the JSON file previously produced by to_dict().

  • creators (Dict[str, object]) – Optional mapping from structure class name to a creator object exposing a createStructure(...) method used to reconstruct instances.

  • gameManager – Optional game manager passed through to creators when required by their signature.

Returns:

A Map instance populated according to the file contents.

Return type:

Map

placeStructure(x, y, structure)

Place structure into the cell at (x, y) if it is empty.

If placement succeeds the method attempts to record grid coordinates on the structure using a best-effort approach (grid_position attribute preferred, or position when the structure signals it expects grid coordinates).

Returns:

True if placement succeeded, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool

Parameters:

  • x (int)

  • y (int)

reconnect_structures(conveyors, game_manager=None)

Re-establish connections between structures and conveyors.

This method collects conveyors, determines which structures are at the conveyor endpoints and connects inputs/outputs on structures using the available connect* helper methods exposed by structure instances.

Parameters:

  • conveyors – Iterable of conveyor-like objects having start_pos and end_pos Vector2 attributes.

  • game_manager – Optional game manager instance. When provided some convenience references (mine, final_conveyor, well) will be set on the manager when they can be determined.

removeStructure(x, y)

Remove and return the structure at (x, y) or None if empty/out of bounds.

Parameters:

  • x (int)

  • y (int)

save_to_file(filepath)

Save the current map layout to filepath as JSON.

Parameters:

filepath (str)

Return type:

None

to_dict()

Serialize map layout to a JSON-friendly dictionary.

The representation is intentionally conservative and stores only simple attributes needed to later reconstruct instances via creator objects.

Return type:

Dict

update()

Call update() on every structure placed in the map (if available).

Return type:

None

class map.cell.Cell(position)

Bases: object

Container for a single grid cell.

This class stores the cell grid coordinates and an optional reference to a structure placed in the cell.

Parameters:

position (Tuple[int, int])

position

Grid coordinates (x, y).

Type:

Tuple[int, int]

structure

Optional reference to a structure object placed in this cell.

getStructure()

Return the structure currently stored in the cell, or None.

isEmpty()

Return True if the cell has no structure.

Return type:

bool

removeStructure()

Remove and return the structure currently in the cell, or None.

Returns:

The removed structure instance, or None if the cell was empty.

setStructure(structure)

Place structure into this cell.

This will overwrite any existing structure. The caller may prefer to check isEmpty() before calling this method.

Parameters:

structure – Any object representing a placed structure.

Return type:

None
